title: Optimized Data Transformation Features
intro: This list represents the optimized features for data transformation platforms, gathered from analyzing 24 sites and 70 features.

features.Supported Data Sources: 100+ data sources including advertising, marketing, CRM, financial, and eCommerce platforms, ad-hoc files, google sheets, cloud storages, relational databases, and real-time data ingestion using webhooks (24)

features.Scheduling and Orchestration: Powerful scheduling and orchestration features with granular control over scheduling down to the exact minute (24)

features.Data Movement Control: Granular control over what data to move, allowing the ability to choose down to field level what data is needed (24)

features.Logging and Fault Tolerance: Extensive logging, fault tolerance, and automated recovery for dependable and reliable pipelines (24)
features.Scalability: Built to scale at an affordable cost, handling billions of rows of data and scaling with the business needs (24)

features.Ease of Use: Get started in minutes with self-serve UI or with the help of on-boarding experts, extensive documentation support and content available (24)

features.Reverse ETL: Activate data with Reverse ETL, sending data to the tools business teams use every day, setting up alerts & notifications, and syncing customer data across all platforms (24)
features.Data Masking: Changes sensitive production data to realistic test data (24)
features.Expression: Calculates values in a single row (24)
features.Joiner: Joins source data from two related heterogeneous sources (24)
features.Filter: Filters out rows in a mapping (24)
features.Lookup: Looks up data in a flat file, relational table, view or synonym (24)
features.Rank: Selects top or bottom rank of data (24)
features.Router: Tests data for one or more conditions and routes rows of data (24)
features.Union: Merges data from multiple pipelines or pipeline branches (24)
features.XML: Adds an XML Source Qualifier transformation to a mapping (24)
features.Normalizer: Receives a row that contains multiple-occurring columns and returns a row for each instance of the multiple-occurring data (24)
features.H2R and R2H Transformation: Converts hierarchical data models to relational database and vice versa (24)

features.Managed Data Warehouse: Option to use a managed data warehouse offering and later configure own warehouse (24)

features.Reverse ETL: Activate data with Reverse ETL, sending data to the tools business teams use every day, setting up alerts & notifications, and syncing customer data across all platforms (24)

features.Cloud Data Warehouse Integration: Embraces the cloud data warehouse as its lynchpin (24)

features.Documentation and Discovery: Captures comprehensive information about the data and facilitates user-generated information (24)
features.Collaboration: Facilitates a collaborative data lifecycle process (24)

features.Custom Metadata: All your metadata in one home (24)

features.Support for various data sources: Relational databases, NoSQL databases, cloud storage, Hadoop-based data lakes (24)
features.Advanced data transformation capabilitie: Machine learning-based data profiling, data cataloging, automatic schema detection (24)
